title: Fetești
text:
Fetești () is a <a href="municipality%20in%20Romania">city</a> in <a href="Ialomi%C8%9Ba%20County">Ialomița County</a>, <a href="Muntenia">Muntenia</a>, <a href="Romania">Romania</a>. It is located in the <a href="B%C4%83r%C4%83gan">Bărăgan</a> plain, on the <a href="Borcea">Borcea</a> branch of the <a href="Danube">Danube</a>. Fetești has the second largest population in Ialomița, after <a href="Slobozia">Slobozia</a>.
In 1895, the <a href="King%20Carol%20I%20Bridge">King Carol I railway Bridge</a> was built across the Danube to <a href="Cernavod%C4%83">Cernavodă</a>. A <a href="Cernavod%C4%83%20Bridge">newer one</a> was built in the 1980s as part of the <a href="Bucharest">Bucharest</a>-<a href="Constan%C8%9Ba">Constanța</a> <a href="A2%20motorway%20%28Romania%29">A2 highway</a>.
History.
The settlement of Fetești was first mentioned in the year 1528, in a document released by the ruler of <a href="Wallachia">Wallachia</a>, <a href="Radu%20of%20Afuma%C8%9Bi">Radu of Afumați</a>. In 1868 Fetești became a <a href="Communes%20of%20Romania">commune</a>, in 1934 a <a href="city">city</a>, and 61 years later, in 1995, it achieved the status of <a href="municipality">municipality</a>. In the course of time, Fetești has evolved to an important crossroads and industrial center.
Structure.
The city is composed of four neighbourhoods: Fetești-Oraș, Fetești-Gară, Buliga and Vlașca; formally, the last three are separate villages. Fetești-Gară has a population of over 20,000 inhabitants, and it is considered to be the center of Fetești.
Education.
There are 7 schools and 3 high-schools in the city. The "Carol I" high-school is the best in the Fetești-<a href="%C8%9A%C4%83nd%C4%83rei">Țăndărei</a> area, and one of the best in the county.
